meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: I goofed up my math homework by adding instead of subtracting.
meanings.sent2: She goofed during the presentation by forgetting her lines.
meanings.sent3: He goofed on his test and accidentally wrote his name instead of the answers.
meanings.sent4: The new employee goofed by sending the email to the wrong client.
meanings.sent5: The chef goofed by mistaking salt for sugar in the recipe, creating a salty cake.

meanings.definition: To act in a silly or foolish manner.
meanings.sent1: The children goofed around in the playground, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent2: During the party, he goofed off by telling jokes and making funny faces.
meanings.sent3: She goofed around in class, making funny faces behind the teacher's back.
meanings.sent4: The friends goofed off at the beach, building sandcastles and splashing in the water.
meanings.sent5: The dog goofed around in the park, chasing its tail and rolling in the grass.
